paragraph.paragraph: One of the major ways ../../../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET and EiffelEnvision differs from other .NET languages is a directory-based compiler, and not a file-based compiler. The Eiffel for .NET compiler, in EiffelEnvision, will examine the contents of a ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcluster and examine all Eiffel source files (*.e), containing Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclasses, when compiling. Examination does not necessarly result in their inclusion when ../../../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuilt, this depends on the project's ../../../configuring/project_configuration/general.xmlinclude_all_classesInclude All Classes project property or if the examined Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclass is reachable via the project's ../../../configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlroot_classRoot Class.

Using a directory base compiler, EiffelEnvision relects what the Eiffel for .NET compiler will see and examine in an EiffelEnvision project. The ../project_items.xmlProject Items and any explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders will automatically enumerate the contents of their associated ../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath, ../project_items.xmlProject Items will always examine the directory where your project is located. During examination, all located .e files are automatically added to an EiffelEnvision project when projects are created or opened in Visual Studio .NET. EiffelEnvision will then monitor all future disk activity, external of Visual Studio .NET, and subsequently add or remove Eiffel source files and folders as they are added and removed from the underlying file system.

Given the nature of ../../project.xmlclean_separationSource Code Reuse and the ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcluster mechanism, projects may include unwanted files or there may be a need to resolve ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclass name clashes by excluding Eiffel source files from a ../../../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuild.

To exclude Eiffel source file or entire folders, include as a result of setting the ../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlinclude_subdirectoriesInclude Subdirectories property on ../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders.

Select the folder ( ../../../../../images/icons/folder.ico ) or file ( ../../../../../images/icons/file_class_blue.ico ) and select Exclude From Project from it's context menu. Once selected the icon will change to ../../../../../images/icons/folder_ex.ico for folders and ../../../../../images/icons/file_class_ex.ico for files. When excluding folders, it and it's entire contents will be excluded.
Note: Exclusion is based on the item name alone and is per-../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcluster. It is possible to exclude an item and it subsequently excludes a number of other items. For instance, in a cluster shared_resources, there are two folders: xml_reader and binary_reader. In both folder there exists common.e. Excluding common.e from xml_reader will also exclude common.e from binary_reader, because common.e is an excluded item of shared_resources. After excluding common.e, EiffelEnvision will automatically show both editons as being excluded by changing the their icons to the excluded class icon ( ../../../../../images/icons/file_class_ex.ico ). If this is an undesired consequence, cluster_folders.xmlpromotingConverting Folders to Clusters will permit the exclusion of only one instance of common.e.
Eiffel source files and folders may also be excluded using a explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder's explicit_clusters.xmlexcluded_itemsExcluded Items property.

In contrast to cluster_enumeration.xmlexcluding_itemExcluding Items, Eiffel source files and folder may need to be included back into projects. For all excluded items, Include into Project is available from the excluded item's context menu. Selecting Include into Project will reintroduce any Eiffel source files back into the project. Some Eiffel source files and folders cannot be included, and Include into Project will be gray out. This is because the items were excluded as part of a higher exclusion. For example, when exluding a folder containing Eiffel source files, it is not possible to include any of those Eiffel source files into the project because they were not directly excluded.
Eiffel source files and folders may also be included back using a explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder's explicit_clusters.xmlexcluded_itemsExcluded Items property.
